body_html: I am mostly concerned with the application of rotation estimation via SVD. After reading through https://arxiv.org/pdf/0904.1613.pdf I recognised that the underlying problem is the uniqueness of the SVD solution for the optimal R. I think the gimbal lock problem is related to Euler angles, not rotation matrices. E.g. rotation estimation via quaternions involves choosing the eigenvector with the largest eigenvalue which also becomes non-unique when all eigenvalues are equal.
